taskGroup.name: Walkthrough
taskGroup.intro:
Introduction
This collection of cheat sheets will teach you how to use Debrief's Semi Automated Track Construction (SATC) capabilities.
Tip: If you have multiple monitors, you may wish to drag out this Cheat Sheets window to give you more room for the multiple Debrief windows that you will use later on.

task.name: Concepts
task.intro:
Background
Before we get started with loading and manipulating data, we're going to learn some of the background terms and concepts.
task.onCompletion:
Conclusion
Ok, that's the boring school work out of the way. The rest of this cheat-sheet is all conducted here in Debrief.

taskGroup.name: Single Leg Solution
taskGroup.intro: Introduction Let's start off with an easy scenario. We're going to work on an engagement where there is just a single leg of target data.
taskGroup.onCompletion: And that's the end of the tutorial for single-leg target track construction.

task.name: Generating a project
task.intro: To be able to save your tutorial data, you need a Debrief Workspace to store your data in. But, if you have a Debrief Navigator window open, and in it you can see one or more folders in it, you can skip this step.
task.onCompletion:
Conclusion
You now have a Debrief Project, to contain your tutorial data.

taskGroup.name: Finding the sample data
taskGroup.intro: There are two ways to load the sample data. We're probably going to end up modifying the sample data, so you shouldn't do that if you're working on a set of sample data that's shared with other users (since you would be modifying the master copy of the data). Start off by considering if your Debrief installation folder is on your local machine, or on a Network Shared Folder.

task.name: Sample data from a local folder
task.intro: You should have a Debrief project open. You will also need a link to the Debrief sample data. So, open up the projects in your Navigator window, and see if there is a folder titled Sample Data, that contains a folder called SATC. If there is one there, you can skip this step.
task.onCompletion:
Conclusion
Ok, you've found the Debrief Sample Data. You're ready for the tutorial now.

task.name: Sample data from a shared folder
task.intro:
You should have a Debrief project open. You will also need a link to the Debrief sample data. So, open up the projects in your Navigator window, and see if there is a folder titled Sample Data, that contains a folder called SATC.
If there is one there, you can skip this step, otherwise click on Start working on this task.
task.onCompletion:
Conclusion
Ok, you've found the Debrief Sample Data. You're ready for the tutorial now.

task.name: Loading the data
task.intro: Let's get some sample data loaded.
task.onCompletion: Ok, now you have ownship track loaded, and you can see the fan of ownship bearing data.

task.name: Creating the scenario
task.intro: Now that data is present, it's time to create a scenario based upon it.
task.onCompletion: We've provided the TMA algorithm with some data, let's see it calculate a solution

task.name: Getting a solution
task.intro: Now for the interesting bit. Let's see SATC generate a solution.
task.onCompletion: We now have a target solution, very close to the truth track, generated by SATC.

task.name: Importing as a TMA track
task.intro: Lastly we're going to import the solution into Debrief as a normal TMA track, for subsequent analysis/exploitation.
task.onCompletion: That's it for single leg solutions. Now close the Debrief plot containing the single-leg solution, (no need to save). Next we'll work on a multi-leg solution.

taskGroup.name: Multi Leg Solution
taskGroup.intro: Now for something a little more advanced. In this tutorial we're going to work with a scenario with several targets zigs, where a number of contributions are required to get a good quality solution.

task.name: Loading the data file
task.intro: Once again, we will start off by loading some data.

task.name: Grooming the data
task.intro: The next step is to provide some analyst contributions.

task.name: Fun with legs
task.intro: We still haven't got enough information to produce a solution, so it's time to provide some leg-related knowledge
task.onCompletion: And that's all for the walkthrough of Debrief's Semi-Automatic Track Construction. You're now on your own.
